description:
Fast-track your keyword research and optimize your content with our Keyword Research and Search Engine Optimization Fast Track Course!

SECTION 1: INTRO TO THE GOOGLE KEYWORD PLANNER

You may remember the moans and groans that echoed through the Internet Marketing forums when Google announced that it would be discontinuing its free Keyword Tool — a staple of the Internet Marketer’s toolbox for over a decade.

Luckily, they didn’t leave us empty handed — they gave us the new and improved Google Keyword Planner — but there are some major changes compared to the old Keyword Tool, so that means major changes in the way you do your keyword research, as well.

If you’re like most busy marketers, poking around inside the Google Keyword Planner itself is a luxury you simply do not have… You need to make the best use of your precious time to run your business and still have time to spend doing the things you love with the people you love.

You're not alone!

In the first section of this course, we’ll cut straight to the chase and cover all the most important points to make sure you understand the differences between the old Keyword Tool and the new Keyword Planner, and of course how to use it effectively.

SECTION 2: KEYWORD RESEARCH MADE EASY

Next, you'll learn how to research and select high-traffic keywords for your niche, as well as how to organize and track your keyword research most efficiently, using our printable workbook and step-by-step instructions.

SECTION 3: PUTTING YOUR SELECTED KEYWORDS TO WORK ON YOUR WEBSITE

Next, you need a steady stream of quality content based on your keywords in order to maximize your site’s search engine rankings and your visitors’ satisfaction.

Spending hours, days and weeks trying to come up with fresh content ideas is another thing we busy marketers have no time for. So we’ll help you shortcut that process as well, putting your selected keywords to work on your website as quickly, easily and effectively as possible with our Fresh Ideas Content Brainstorming Series!

SECTION 4: OPTIMIZING YOUR CONTENT FOR SEARCH ENGINES

Lastly, after compiling all your fresh content ideas, you need to make sure your content is targeted toward the right customer demographic, with effective headlines, and optimized for the search engines. Then you have to notify the search engines that you exist.

We’ll help you do all of that and more in the final section of this course, which includes our comprehensive workbook walking you step-by-step through the process, using both on-site and off-site search engine optimization strategies.
title: Keyword Research and Search Engine Optimization Fast Track
